title: Blackjack Wear
summary: Blackjack for Android Wear.  Play twenty-one on Android smart watches.
description: ***New version supports Moto 360 just released!**As this is still in beta, we appreciate comments and feedback to help make this app better.  Thank you for the feedback.  We've made changes to the app in response to your comments.  With the latest version, it now supports all Android smart watches including Moto 360, LG G, and Samsung Gear Live.Introducing the first card game app for Android smart watches, Blackjack Wear.  Play Vegas style black jack from the watch with swipe gestures.Blackjack Wear is compatible with the latest version of Android wear for all smart watches including LG G Watch, and Samsung Gear Live.Beta Features Include:Play with easy to use swipe gestures--Swipe down to Hit--Swipe up to StayChange your blackjack table from the "options" menuLessen or Increase your bet amountsDouble DownUpcoming Features:Improved UISplit CardsGesture/Click OptionThere's a new way to play this classic card game...on your watch!  If you like playing Blackjack aka twenty-one on your phone, you'll love playing Blackjack on your wearable Android smart watch:  LG G Watch, Moto 360, and Samsung Gear Live.
descriptionHTML:
***New version supports Moto 360 just released!

**As this is still in beta, we appreciate comments and feedback to help make this app better. Thank you for the feedback. We've made changes to the app in response to your comments. With the latest version, it now supports all Android smart watches including Moto 360, LG G, and Samsung Gear Live.

Introducing the first card game app for Android smart watches, Blackjack Wear. Play Vegas style black jack from the watch with swipe gestures.

Blackjack Wear is compatible with the latest version of Android wear for all smart watches including LG G Watch, and Samsung Gear Live.

Beta Features Include:
Play with easy to use swipe gestures
--Swipe down to Hit
--Swipe up to Stay
Change your blackjack table from the "options" menu
Lessen or Increase your bet amounts
Double Down

Upcoming Features:
Improved UI
Split Cards
Gesture/Click Option

There's a new way to play this classic card game...on your watch! If you like playing Blackjack aka twenty-one on your phone, you'll love playing Blackjack on your wearable Android smart watch: LG G Watch, Moto 360, and Samsung Gear Live.
comments: Excellent interface, but math is off The interface is very intuitive, but on some occasions one can not see the placed bet. Unfortunately the calculations have some bugs. For instance one loses the placed bet, when the app is exited. Or even if you win a little, you end up with less money than you started with. But still it's a lot of fun and astoundingly good for a watch game.

Very cool Fun to play, a nice way to the pass time as you can start or stop when ever you want. My only complaint is I cannot split. Perhaps the watch face is not big enough for the gesture to work? Please change the gesture! Double down works fine, cannot double down.

Winner winner, chicken dinner! As simple as it is, a lot of thought has gone into this game, to adapt it to the unique interface and input of a "smart" watch as precisely as possible... And the developer has done a spectacular job (though I do wonder why one's bet only shows some of the time - this is a confusing design flaw!). Blackjack Wear looks fantastic, it's easy to use, works flawlessly and most importantly, it's plenty of fun! Very highly recommended, for all users of Android Wear "smart" watches.

Moto 360 OK so with the newest update the app runs on the 360. It takes a while to get used to the swipes. They are short-distance swipes, not from the edge of the screen. But anyways, fun way to kill a few minutes here and there.

Hole card showing glitch graphics Running on a Huawei watch, the hole card's right side is shown partially revealing the hole card before the player stays. Also the split and double gestures are prone to mistakes please just include buttons when opportunity is present. Stay and hit function well

game is good. Minor flaws like always resets bet to 5 no matter if change settings or previous bet. Sometimes can't even see how much you bet at all. Also Aces should be either 1 or 11 but game often counts as 0.
recentChanges: Feedback and suggestions welcome as we continuously improve this beta version.  We strive to make this the best card game for the Android smart watch.
